channel.title: Windows Live Problem
channel.description:
So I had been playing games that require it, like Arkham Asylum and GTAIV, perfectly fine until I started Red Faction Guerrilla. It had me create another Live ID plus an Xbox Live ID to play. And now when I just started up GTAIV it started a new game. I want to continue from where I left off with, though. Any ideas on how to fix this?
Edit: I don't remember creating the first one. It was just there when I started the game up. I had to actively create this second one.

item.title: Windows Live Problem
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
You do realize that I already fixed this right? I still need to do it for AA, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Live Problem
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
Jeez, you must suck at using google :hmph:

If you wanna carry on where you left off, you still have your savegame right? All you had to do was download a little app called ‘liveless’ and add that to your GTA4. Then it would avoid GFWL and load saves from a different location.

It sucks that your saves are inherently tied to your account, but that’s the way it is. I used this method to grab a 100% complete save, as I’ve completed the game already, and wanted to scope out some mods I’d added.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Live Problem
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
That’s why I use the cracked version of GTA4 that doesn’t require GFWL nor RGSC, and it saves in Users\sersoft\Documents :awesome:

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Live Problem
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Oh sorry. This isn’t on Xbox, this is for the computer. With Steam.

When I first started up GTAIV (it might have been Arkham Asylum, whichever I started first) it automatically signed me into a profile, which was named Andrew.

When I loaded Guerrilla, however, it made me make an entire other Live account for some reason, as well as an Xbox Live account.

Sorry if this is confusing. I just want to know how to sign into my old profile so I don’t have to entirely restart my games.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Live Problem
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
I am having my own issues with connecting my xbox 360 with my pc windows media center myself. But I DO know that when I tried to create an xbox 360 profile with my hotmail / live account, it said it was taken. I had to use a yahoo account.

Ok. Which one of you diptwads took my hotmail / live account for your 360 profile?!

Kairouseki… how many profiles you got on your xbox? Is it under a different profile?

Read full topic
